result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick E Diggins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 11 years bifurcated sentence.
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent. Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users. Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Continue to participate in a support program. Engage in a cognitive thinking or therapy program. Comply with family court order. Write a letter of apology to the victim and turn it into the agent. Pay outstanding ZCI fees. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

**AMENDED 4/24/2019: To reflect that defendant must complete a sex offender assessment and follow through with any recommended programming.**

timeConds.notes: STAYED. Credit for time served only to be applied if revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, CSM (person, property, residence or family).
